result.execSummary:
The defendant Rene Valdez Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
IF REVOKED:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes:
Buy money in the amount of $594.00 to be paid to Waukesha Drug Metro Unit as a Condition of Probation.
Court costs also to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Submit to random drug screens.
Not to use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
Not to use or possess prescriptions without a valid prescription.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.

timeConds.notes:
Condition Time - First 4 1/2 months with huber, STAYED the last 1 1/2 months, and to be used at Agent's discretion as well as to the huber or straight time.

AS OF 3/14/2016: Court amends to allow huber to be transferred to Milwaukee County, with NO ELECTRONIC MONITORING.
Consecutive to: Count 5

Defendant Rene Valdez in court with Attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Fragoso requests a 30-45 day adjournment.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on June 29, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Rene Valdez in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Officer L. Brooks from the Village of Menomonee Falls was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. Cross examination by the defense. Redirect by the State.  State rests. No testimony by the defense. State moves for bind over. Defense objects. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.    NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 14, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Rene Valdez in court.  Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant still needs more time to get counsel.  Court grants the adjournment request.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 10:00 am.
